overview:
This class allows you interact with Stackdriver Logging.

First, install @google-cloud/logging with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/logging

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/loggingâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var logging = require('@google-cloud/logging')();

Elsewhere

var logging = require('@google-cloud/logging')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/logging are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: MetricsServiceV2Client
methods.description:
Service for configuring logs-based metrics.

This will be created through a builder function which can be obtained by the module. See the following example of how to initialize the module and how to access to the builder.

methods.name: projectPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified project resource name string.

methods.name: matchProjectFromProjectName
methods.description: Parses the projectName from a project resource.

params.name: projectName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a project resources.

methods.name: metricPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified metric resource name string.

methods.name: matchProjectFromMetricName
methods.description: Parses the metricName from a metric resource.

params.name: metricName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a metric resources.

methods.name: matchMetricFromMetricName
methods.description: Parses the metricName from a metric resource.

params.name: metricName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a metric resources.

methods.name: getProjectId
methods.description: Get the project ID used by this class.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.parent
params.description:
Required. The name of the project containing the metrics:

 "projects/[PROJECT_ID]"

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is Array of LogMetric.

When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, it contains the result in a single response. If the response indicates the next page exists, the third parameter is set to be used for the next request object. The fourth parameter keeps the raw response object of an object representing ListLogMetricsResponse.

returns.description:
• The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is Array of LogMetric.

    When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, the array has three elements. The first element is Array of LogMetric in a single response. The second element is the next request object if the response indicates the next page exists, or null. The third element is an object representing ListLogMetricsResponse.

    The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listLogMetricsStream
methods.description:
Equivalent to {@link listLogMetrics}, but returns a NodeJS Stream object.

This fetches the paged responses for {@link listLogMetrics} continuously and invokes the callback registered for 'data' event for each element in the responses.

The returned object has 'end' method when no more elements are required.

autoPaginate option will be ignored.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.parent
params.description:
Required. The name of the project containing the metrics:

 "projects/[PROJECT_ID]"

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

returns.description: An object stream which emits an object representing LogMetric on 'data' event.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.metricName
params.description:
The resource name of the desired metric:

 "projects/[PROJECT_ID]/metrics/[METRIC_ID]"

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing LogMetric.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing LogMetric. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.parent
params.description:
The resource name of the project in which to create the metric:

 "projects/[PROJECT_ID]"

The new metric must be provided in the request.

params.name: request.metric
params.description:
The new logs-based metric, which must not have an identifier that already exists.

This object should have the same structure as LogMetric

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing LogMetric.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing LogMetric. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.metricName
params.description:
The resource name of the metric to update:

 "projects/[PROJECT_ID]/metrics/[METRIC_ID]"

The updated metric must be provided in the request and it's name field must be the same as [METRIC_ID] If the metric does not exist in [PROJECT_ID], then a new metric is created.

params.name: request.metric
params.description:
The updated metric.

This object should have the same structure as LogMetric

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing LogMetric.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing LogMetric. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.metricName
params.description:
The resource name of the metric to delete:

 "projects/[PROJECT_ID]/metrics/[METRIC_ID]"

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description: The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves when API call finishes. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: opts
params.description: • The optional parameters.

params.name: opts.servicePath
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: opts.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: opts.sslCreds
params.description: A ClientCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel.

params.name: opts.clientConfig
params.description: The customized config to build the call settings. See {@link gax.constructSettings} for the format.
